page.title: 09The Croys
page.content: The Croys is about 1.5 miles from KPD and about 300 yds from the crossroads at the top of the village of Bridge of Urr. The Croys house was built about 1700-1800. It was first owned by Kilquhanity estate. It started as a small farmhouse but was then sold to Skirving who built on the rest of the house, the middle and the East wing, in the years 1875-1930. It has a large garden with a good selection of foods, for example peas, marrows, cucumber, pears, apples and tomatoes. The garden has one door and is surrounded by a wall which is about 6-7 ft. At one point it is only about 5 ft. You can get on to the wall but you have to get over a 3 ft fence. The apples taste very nice and the pears are alright. I used to work there. I used to cut grass, fetch wood and help clean the 10-20 rooms.
